document.docAuthor: Oliveira, Daniel C., Charanasri, Vatana, Kongchuensin, Manita, Konvipasruang, Ploychompoo, Chandrapatya, Angsumarn & De, Gilberto J.
document.masterDocTitle: Phytoseiidae of Thailand (Acari: Mesostigmata), with a key for their identification

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Phytoseiidae of Thailand (Acari: Mesostigmata), with a key for their identification

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Amblyseius ( Paraphytoseius ) multidentatus
.—
Ehara & Bhandhufalck, 1977
: 79
(misidentified according to
Ehara et al ., 2000
: 114
).

Paraphytoseius cracentis
.—
Moraes et al ., 1986
: 104
; 2004 b: 160 ;
Chant & McMurtry, 2003 a
: 220
; 2007 : 53 .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Specimens examined. Two females, on
Cyanthillium cinereum
(L.) H.Rob., at Rayong Province,
November 1996
; three females and one male, on
Oxyceros künstleri
, at Chachoengsao Province,
January 2001
; five females and two males, on
Acacia
sp., at Chanthaburi Province,
April 2001
, collected by S. Yimchan.

Dorsal shield 292 ( 265–310 ) long and 158 ( 150–168 ) wide;
j 1

92 ( 82–98 ),

73 ( 71– 76 ),

89 ( 84–92 ); ventrianal shield 112 ( 104–120 ) long, 66 ( 53–74 ) wide at level of
ZV 2
; calyx of spermatheca 8 ( 7–10 ) long; fixed cheliceral digit 28 ( 26–30 ) long, movable cheliceral digit 34 ( 32–37 ) long;

Dorsal shield 243 ( 235–255 ) long and 143 ( 140–147 ) wide;

15 ( 15–16 ); ventrianal shield 102 ( 101–102 ) long and 124 ( 120–126 ) wide at level of anterior corners; fixed cheliceral digit 19 ( 18–20 ) long, movable cheliceral digit 23 ( 21–24 ) long; spermatodactyl 16 ( 15–17 ) long;

IV 37
( 35–40 ), St (telotarsus)

( 37–40 ). Chaetotaxy of genua II and III as in female.

Remarks. Measurements of the females examined are similar to those of the original description and those reported by
Ehara & Bhandhufalck ( 1977 )
for specimens from Thailand . Unlike what was reported by
Corpuz & Rimando ( 1966 )
, females examined have a pair of pores on the ventrianal shield; these are small, difficult to see and located posterior and slightly mediad to
JV 2
. Measures of males are similar to those reported by
Ehara & Bhandhufalck ( 1977 )
for specimens from Thailand .
